conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D. Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The first image shows labeled starting points (A, B, C, D) at the top and destination containers (E, F) at the bottom.
The second and third images show the actual liquid flow paths after release.
Liquid A (Orange) starts from the leftmost position (orange tab).
In images 2 and 3, the orange liquid drops straight down.
Liquid A follows the left side of the board.
Liquid A eventually reaches the left container (E), as shown by the orange drops collecting there.
Liquid B (Light Blue/White) starts from the second position from the left (light blue/white tab).
Liquid B flows down and encounters several colored rods.
The flow path of Liquid B shows it connects with the mint/turquoise colored rod.
Following Liquid B's path leads to the mint/turquoise container on the right (F).
Liquid C (Blue) starts from the middle position (blue tab).
In images 2 and 3, the blue liquid flows down and interacts with the green rod.
Liquid C's flow continues downward and to the left.
Liquid C eventually joins with paths from liquid B, leading to container F.
Liquid D (Yellow) starts from the right side (yellow tab).
Liquid D flows downward along the right side of the board.
Liquid D interacts with the white rod.
Liquid D's path continues downward to the right.
Liquid D ends up in the right container (F).
